attack-object.name: Valid Accounts
attack-object.score-comment: This control is able to detect some of this technique's sub-techniques resulting in a Partial Coverage score and consequently an overall score of Partial.

attack-object.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
attack-object.score-comment: This control's detection is specific to a minority of this technique's sub-techniques resulting in a Minimal Coverage score and consequently an overall score of Minimal.

attack-object.name: User Execution
attack-object.score-comment: This control provides detection for one of the two sub-techniques of this technique,  Malicious File, resulting in a Partial Coverage score and consequently an overall score of Partial.

attack-object.name: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism
attack-object.score-comment: The only sub-technique scored (Bypass User Account Control) is the only one relevant to Windows.

attack-object.name: Process Injection
attack-object.score-comment: This control's Fileless Attack Detection covers all relevant sub-techniques. Detection is periodic at an unknown rate.

attack-object.name: Exploitation for Client Execution
attack-object.score-comment: This control's Fileless Attack Detection identifies shellcode executing within process memory, including shellcode executed as a payload in the exploitation of a software vulnerability. Detection is periodic at an unknown rate. The following alerts may be generated: "Fileless attack technique detected", "Fileless attack behavior detected", "Fileless  attack toolkit detected", "Suspicious SVCHOST process executed".

attack-object.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
attack-object.score-comment: This control may detect decoding of suspicious files by certutil.exe and may detect the presence of various encoding schemes to obfuscate malicious scripts and commandline arguments. The following alerts may be generated: "Suspicious download using Certutil detected", "Suspicious download using Certutil detected [seen multiple times]", "Detected decoding of an executable using built-in certutil.exe tool".

attack-object.name: File and Directory Permissions Modification
attack-object.score-comment: This control provides minimal detection for some of this technique's sub-techniques resulting in an overall score of Minimal.

attack-object.name: Hide Artifacts
attack-object.score-comment: This control's detection is specific to a minority of this technique's sub-techniques resulting in a Minimal Coverage score and consequently an overall score of Minimal.

attack-object.name: Impair Defenses
attack-object.score-comment: This control's detection is specific to a minority of this technique's sub-techniques resulting in a Minimal Coverage score and consequently an overall score of Minimal.

attack-object.name: Indicator Removal on Host
attack-object.score-comment: This control's detection is specific to a minority of this technique's sub-techniques and procedure examples  resulting in a Minimal Coverage score and consequently an overall score of Minimal.

attack-object.name: Modify Registry
attack-object.score-comment: This control may detect several methods used to modify the registry for purposes of persistence, privilege elevation, and execution. The following alerts may be generated: "Detected change to a registry key that can be abused to bypass UAC", "Detected enabling of the WDigest UseLogonCredential registry key", "Detected suppression of legal notice displayed to users at logon", "Suspicious WindowPosition registry value detected", "Windows registry persistence method detected".

attack-object.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
attack-object.score-comment: This control may detect usage of VBScript.Encode and base-64 encoding to obfuscate malicious commands and scripts. The following alerts may be generated: "Detected suspicious execution of VBScript.Encode command", "Detected encoded executable in command line data".

attack-object.name: Signed Binary Proxy Execution
attack-object.score-comment: This control's detection is specific to a minority of this technique's sub-techniques resulting in a Minimal Coverage score and consequently an overall score of Minimal.

attack-object.name: Brute Force
attack-object.score-comment: This control provides detection for some of this technique's sub-techniques and procedure examples resulting  in a Partial Coverage score and consequently an overall score of Partial.

attack-object.name: OS Credential Dumping
attack-object.score-comment: This control provides detection for a minority of this technique's sub-techniques and procedure examples  resulting in a Minimal Coverage score and consequently an overall score of Minimal.  Furthermore, its detection capability relies on detecting the usage of specific tools (e.g. sqldumper.exe) further adversely impacting  its score.

attack-object.name: Steal or Forge Kerberos Tickets
attack-object.score-comment: This control's detection is specific to a minority of this technique's sub-techniques resulting in a Minimal Coverage score and consequently an overall score of Minimal.

attack-object.name: System Information Discovery
attack-object.score-comment: This control may detect local reconnaissance activity specific to using the systeminfo commands. The following alerts may be generated: "Detected possible local reconnaissance activity".

attack-object.name: Remote Service Session Hijacking
attack-object.score-comment: This control provides partial detection for some of this technique's sub-techniques  resulting in a Partial Coverage score and consequently an overall score of Partial.

attack-object.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
attack-object.score-comment: This control may detect usage of malware droppers and creation of suspicious files on the host machine. The following alerts may be generated: "Detected possible execution of malware dropper", "Detected suspicious file creation".

attack-object.name: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol
attack-object.score-comment: This control's detection is specific to a minority of this technique's sub-techniques and procedure examples resulting in a Minimal Coverage score and consequently an overall score of Minimal.

attack-object.name: Service Stop
attack-object.score-comment: This control may detect when critical services have been disabled through the usage of specifically net.exe. The following alerts may be generated: "Detected the disabling of critical services".

attack-object.name: Indirect Command Execution
attack-object.score-comment: This control may detect suspicious use of Pcalua.exe to launch executable code. There are other methods of indirect command execution that this control may not detect. The following alerts may be generated: "Detected suspicious use of Pcalua.exe to launch executable code".
